ags:resource.dc:title: CORRECTION OF LOCAL FACTORS OF PROTECTION AND MICROBIOCENOSIS OF THE GASTROINTESTINAL TRACT IN TERMS OF USING COLLOIDAL SILVER TO CHICKENS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article is devoted to studying local protection of chickens when using colloidal silver. It is shown that under the influence of the drug local mechanisms of protection of a mucous membrane of a trachea and an oropharynx are intensified as a result of increasing quantity of phagocytizing leukocytes and adsorbing epithelial cells (and their adsorptive activity). Bifidobacterium prevail in intestines.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: DYNAMICS OF MICRO-MORPHOLOGY OF THE THYMUS GLAND OF BOARS IN POST-NATAL ONTOGENESIS GROWN UP WITH THE USE OF MICROELEMENT BIOADDITIVES

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The scientific work is devoted to the study of the influence of Permamik and Kaltsefit-5 on histological structure of the thymus of boars grown in the ecological environment of the northern part of the Volga region (Chuvash Republic). The possibility of combined application of Permamik with Kaltsefit-5 in the various periods of postnatal ontogenesis in order to strengthen the immunological status of boars is determined.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: EXPANSION OF HERD HORSE-BREEDING FROM THE CENTRAL PART TO THE ARCTIC REGIONS OF YAKUTIA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author analyzes the population of horses in Yakutia during various periods and compares it with population of cattle. Cyclic pattern of rising and recession of a ratio of population of horses and cattle during various historical periods is determined. Comparison with deer population in the allocated periods is made. On the basis of the analysis carried-out an attempt to prove the expansion of space for herds of the Yakut breed of horses as the process of expansion of horse-breeding to the Arctic zone of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) is made. On this basis conclusions about the need to use the process of extension of horse-breeding to the South of the Republic (occurring without interventions from the outside, based on the internal pattern of development) in organization and management of animal husbandry are made.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: FIRST LIPIDIC BCW AND LIPOPROTEINS OF CELLS AND BLOOD

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The possibility of creation of lipidic catalyst systems and lipoproteins in the pre-cellular period of life development is concidered.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: GROWTH OF PINE CULTURES AT IMPROVEMENT THINNING SITES ON AUTOMORPHIC SOILS OF NORTHERN KAZAKHSTAN

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Author presents data on researches of growth and development of pine trees and forest stands on the improvement thinning sites. The competition between separate individual trees decreases as the growing space increases. For intensive development the improvement thinning in pine cultures should be initiated at the age of 10-13.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: INFLUENCE OF THE NITROGEN OXIDE SYNTHESIS MODULATORS ON THE CATHEPSIN B, L, H ACTIVITY IN MONONUCLEAR LEUCOCYTES OF RATS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The influence of nitrogen oxide synthesis modulators on cathepsin B, L, H activity in mononuclear leukocytes was studied. It was found out, that cathepsin B, L, H activity in mononuclear leukocytes insignificantly decreases in case of excess of NO synthesis substrate and increases in case of the lack of NO synthesis, and also in case of combined injection of L-Name and L-arginine.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: MEDICAL AND BIOLOGICAL ASPECTS OF SAFETY OF SPACE FLIGHTS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The space ship with astronauts flying through space is a small island of life in the vast lifeless ocean. The crew safety depends on many factors. One of the main reasons is medical-biological problems.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: MODERN PROBLEMS AND PECULIARITIES OF TRANSITION TO PRINCIPLES OF SUSTAINABLE FORESTRY IN NOVGOROD FORESTS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author has considered the possibility of transition to the model of sustainable forest management in the Novgorod forests. The experience of selection of forests with high conservation value for the biodiversity conservation in forest management is shown.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: QUANTITATIVE CHANGES IN CYSTATIN C IN SERUM OF PATIENTS WITH VARICOSE VEINS OF THE LOWER LIMBS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Author considers the quantitative changes in cystatin C in serum of patients with varicose veins of the lower limbs in comparison with a control group of donors comparable by age and sex. A large number of researchers consider the cystatin C as a significant predictor of cardiovascular events, incidence of heart failures and deaths from any causes in most of ethnic groups, regardless of age, sex amd muscle bulk.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: RECREATION RESOURCES OF THE SOUTHERN URAL: POSSIBILITY AND PROBLEMS OF USE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors consider recreation resources of the South Ural and the current degree of their use. The authors also determine resources of the South Ural not used in the recreation process. The possibility of using these resources is determined.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: RELATIONSHIP AND INTERDEPENDENCE OF SUCCESSION AND EVOLUTIONARY PROCESSES IN THE EARTH LIVING COVER DYNAMICS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The transformation of the living cover (biocoenotic self-regulation) can be performed by changing the species communities' composition, as well as through the acquisition of specific adaptations of populations. Both the succession of species and evolutionary transformations are possible due to the transformation of ecological niches. Since the emergence of new forms is always accompanied by the elimination of an enormous number of individuals, evolutionary processes are uneconomical compared to succession. Population structure of the species provides a species-specific flux of living material between different ecosystems. This contributes to limitation of the evolutionary processes with the succession, accompanied by a significant economy of living matter in the biosphere.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: SILVICULTURAL-ECOLOGICAL SIGNIFICANCE OF BROAD-LEAVED FORESTS OF THE NORTHWEST OF RUSSIA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author considers the silvicultural and ecological characteristics of the broad-leaved forests of the Northwest of Russia, in particular biodiversity and productivity.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: STRUCTURAL AND ULTRA-STRUCTURAL ORGANIZATION OF LYMPH GLANDS OF WILD PIGS IN CONDITIONS OF AFRICAN SWINE FEVER (EXPERIMENTAL STUDY)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors presents data on the structural and ultra-structural organization of the immune system organs (lymph glands) of wild pigs in terms of experimental reproduction of the African Swine Fever (ASF) with highly virulent field isolate of the second genotype ASF virus circulating on the Russian Federation territory.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: TECHNOLOGICAL QUALITIES OF THE SUGAR BEET ROOTS IN TERMS OF USE OF THE NITROGENOUS FERTILIZERS IN VARIOUS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors present results of the research of productivity and technological qualities of the sugar beat root crops. Authors have revealed the regularities of changes in the productivity and technological qualities of the sugar beat root crops in terms of using nitrogenous fertilizers in different doses. The reasonability of using the total yield of the cleaned up sugar while estimating the productivity of the sugar beat hybrids is also determined.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: ANTHROPOMETRICAL INDEXES OF PUPILS OF RURAL MUNICIPAL ESTABLISHMENTS IN ULYANOVSK REGION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Physical development is one of objective indicators of a state of health of the population that changes now very sharply, as well as other indicators (diseases, death rate, infantile death rate, average life expectancy, etc.). Methods of the statistical accounting and analysis of the data about physical development of the population have received a deep scientific substantiation and are widely used in practical research activity of establishments of public health services. As a result of research the assessment of anthropometrical indicators of schoolboys of rural municipal unions of the Ulyanovsk region is made. Researches were made in the territory of the Ulyanovsk region from 2008 till 2011. Eight areas with different quality of social and ecological factors of environment have been chosen for the research. Among schoolboys of the senior and average age group schoolboys from only two areas have harmonious development.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: BIOSTRUCTURES FROM ELEMENTARY PARTICLES OF LIPOPROTEINS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The possibility of creation of different biostructures from elementary particles of lipoproteins in pre-cellular period of life development is considered.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: BIOTECHNOLOGY OF PRODUCTS OF FUNCTIONAL NUTRITION ON THE BASIS OF LACTOBACILLUS SELECTED IN THE BIOTECHNOLOGY RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF GSAU

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: A high-grade and healthy food is one of the most important and necessary conditions for preservation of life and national health.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: COMPREHENSIVE PHARMACORRECTION OF THE SECONDARY IMMUNODEFICIENCY STATE OF PIGLETS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors focus on the fact that in the development of immunopathology of piglets the big role belongs to the violation of the vitamin-mineral metabolism. Therefore, the importance of research, aimed at development of the comprehensive farmacocorrection of the immunodeficiency state of piglets.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF RESOURCES OF THE CASPIAN SEA AND IMPERATIVES OF SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT OF ECONOMY IN KAZAKHSTAN

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Development of resources of the Caspian sea is predetermined by potential reserves if hydrocarbons in this region, evaluated differently. Thus, according to the German expert Adolph Matias, about 3.5% of all world oil deposits and 4.3% of planetary gas deposits are concentrated here. A whole range of experts considers that such data is overestimated, although all of them are confident that in the XXI century this region will occupy a considerable place among countries extracting energy resources.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: EPIZOOTIC AND EPIDEMIC SITUATION ON RABIES AND PERSPECTIVE WAYS OF ITS PROPHYLAXIS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The paper contains the epizootic and epidemic situation on human and animal rabies in the Republic of Kazakhstan and Kostanai region. The author explains dangers and influence of the disease on humans, methods of diagnostics, ways of prevention and fighting the disease.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: EPIZOOTIC SITUATION AND DIAGNOSTICS OF CATTLE BRUCELLOSIS IN AGRICULTURAL ESTABLISHMENTS OF KOSTANAY REGION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author presents the material on the epizootic situation on cattle brucellosis in the Kostanay region. The author also presents comparative diagnostic value of modern and classical methods of diagnostics of this disease.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: EXAMINATION OF CORRELATION BETWEEN ACTIVITY OF LYSOSOMAL CYCTEINE PROTEINASES AND LEUKOCYTES OF BLOOD WITH BIOCHEMICAL MARKERS OF INFLAMMATION AT THROMBOPHLEBITIS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: A positive correlation between the average activity of cathepsin L and the concentration of sialic acids in plasma is found, and low positive correlation between the activity of cathepsin H and the concentration of CRP in the polymorphonuclear leukocytes of patients with thrombophlebitis of the leg veins is found. High correlation between the activity of cathepsin H and the concentration of C - reactive protein, and a weak correlation between the activity of cathepsin H and sialic acid concentration in plasma in the mononuclear leukocytes were observed.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: IMPACT OF NATURAL AND ANTHROPOGENIC FACTORS ON THE STATE, SUSTAINABILITY, AND REPRODUCTION OF NOVGOROD WOODS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Impact of natural and anthropogenic factors on timber ecosystems in various timber landscapes is considered.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: INDUSTRIAL FORESTS GROWTH ON CHESTNUT SOILS OF DRY STEPPE ZONE ON THE EUROPEAN TERRITORY OF RUSSIA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Authors present materials on assessment of growth and the current state of massive petiolate oak trees in dry steppe, their dependence on the soil and climate, silvicultural factors. The ways of increasing their durability and drainage efficiency are offered.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: PATHOMORPHOLOGIC CHANGES OF DOMESTIC PIGS AT EXPERIMENTAL REPRODUCTION OF THE AFRICAN SWINE FEVER

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors present data on experimental reproduction of African Swine Fever (ASF) at domestic pigs, infected with highly virulent field isolate of the ASF virus of second genotype, circulating on the Russian Federation territory. The main pathomorphological changes are marked.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: REAL SITUATION CONCERNING CATTLE LEUKOSIS, MAIN VECTORS OF PROPHYLAXIS AND SANITATION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: On the basis of reliable actual material, the author shows epizootic situation on cattle leukosis in Kazakhstan and Kostanay region, as well as diagnostics of this disease in the country and main problems of prophylaxis and elimination of the disease.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: RESOURCES, ECOLOGICAL SAFETY OF MEDICINAL PLANTS OF THE PERM REGION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The resource-management research of wild medicinal plants has been carried out in Perm region for 30 years. The monitoring has shown that reduction of reserves and areas covered by medicinal plants is connected with human activities. The most exposed species of medicinal plants belong to ruderal vegetation.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: SCIENTIFIC AND NATURE PROTECTION SIGNIFICANCE OF MODEL SITUATIONS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF ECOSYSTEMS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Model situations that arise due to disturbances of the structure of the living cover and dynamics of ecosystem succession, are often unique ecological experiments. The author examines the value of model situations for research and conservation. Taking into account their specific nature, an addition to the existing environmental protection categories system is offered.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: MICROMORPHOLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF TESTICLES AND GAMETES OF BOARS, RAISED WITH APPLICATION OF MODERN BIOLOGICAL DRUGS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The scientific work is devoted to the study of the influence of Permait, Kaltsefit-5 and Sedimin® on histological structure of gonads and morphology of sperm cells of boars, grown in the ecological environment of the Central part of the Chuvash Republic. The possibility of combined application of Permait with Kaltsefit-5, as well as Permait with Sedimin® to boars in periods of formation of the sexual function in order to strengthen the andrological status.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: ABOUT HELMINTH FAUNA OF CORSAC FOXES INHABITING THE SOUTH OF KAZAKHSTAN

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the article the results of examination of Vulpis corsac in order to determine their helminth fauna are provided. The helminthological dissection of gastrointestinal tract revealed up to seven types of helminths, two of which (Alveococcus multilocularis, Toxocara canis) have epidemiological value.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: BIORESOURCE POTENTIAL OF UKRAINIAN PONDS WITH WIDE FIELD OF USE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The paper presents data on the ponds of Ukraine, an estimation of trophic properties and productivity of ponds with different operating conditions. It is noted that their real productivity does not reach the theoretically possible values. The issues of the effectiveness and complex use of the ponds, as well as their importance for biodiversity conservation are discussed.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: CREATION OF A STEADY GREEN BELT «THE BIG VLADIVOSTOK»

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Primorskiy Territory, in comparison with other regions and areas of Far East region, is densely enough populated, especially its southern part. Therefore the region’s nature was exposed to a strong anthropogenous pressure. Now Primorski Territory is chosen by base for realization of some large-scale projects, in particular, carrying out of a forum of the Asian-Pacific economic cooperation in 2012, programme introductions «the Big Vladivostok» and resettlements of compatriots on a governmental programme and other federal programmes.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: LEAD INTOXICATION AND ADAPTIVE POSSIBILITIES OF ORGANISMS OF ANIMALS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author considers age-related and reproductive characteristics of the spatial orientation of rats under the influence of small and "shock" lead nitrate doses. Dependence of the orientation stability on individual motor activity of animals and its changes in conditions of lead intoxication are represented.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: MACRO-MICROSCOPIC STRUCTURE OF THYMUS AND HEMOLYMPHATIC NODES OF BOVINE ANIMALS REGARDING THEIR AGE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The presented study dwells on the thymus structure and hemolymphatic nodes of bovine animals regarding their age particularities

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: ON THE REGIONAL PROBLEMS OF ECOLOGICAL MONITORING OF SOILS AND ZONE OF DISPOSAL OF SOLID DOMESTIC GARBAGE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In this article selective supervisions and special research of soil in the Surskiy region in connection with population health hazard are presented.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: PECULIARITIES OF NITRATE CONTAMINATION OF PLANT PRODUCTS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The author describes the influence of nitrogen compounds in living organisms on biological processes and the environmental pollution. Peculiarities of accumulation of nitrates in plants are analyzed. The problem of contamination of plant products with nitrates in Georgia is especially emphasized.The following means are used to solve the problem of influence of chemical substances on the environment: modern machinery, developed farming culture, fertilizers, complex chemical means, progressive processing technologies etc.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: THE PHYSIOLOGICAL STATE OF HOGS IN TERMS OF APPLICATION OF BIOLOGICAL DRUGS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article is devoted to features of a physiological state of hogs while using Permait and Kaltsefit-5 and Sedimin® in biogeochemical conditions of the central zone of the Chuvash Republic.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: THE PROJECT OF THE RE-INTRODUCTION OF SCHREIBER’S BENT-WINGED BATS (MINIOPTERUS SCHREIBERSII, CHIROPTERA) IN THE PENINSULA OF CRIMEA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The background and objectives of the project are presented in detail. They are connected with implementation of the world first re-introduction of the local bats population, namely the species Miniopterus schreibersii, in the peninsula of Crimea (Ukraine).

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: THE ROLE OF EPYPHYSIS IN HEMOCOAGULATION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In article the role of epiphysis in hemocoagulation, in regulation of a functional condition of a humoral link of a hemostasis is considered. It is shown that epiphysis is one of determinatives in neurohormonal regulation of functional system of a fibrillation; the role of epiphysis in hemocoagulational effect of monoamines (adrenaline, aminazine, serotonin) is studied. On the basis of own researches and theoretical judgements it is shown for the first time that epiphyseal – hypothalamic – hypophysis - adrenal system regulates system of fibrillation.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: THE TOPOGRAPHY OF PEPTIDASES IN THE INTESTINES OF HEALTHY AND SICK PIGLETS OF DIFFERENT AGE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: This article contains some questions concerning the pathogenesis of intestinal diseases in piglets. During the inflammatory process in intestines of ill animals the change of character of distribution of activity of digestive enzymes along small and large bowel can be observed.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: VETERINARY TOXICOLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF FEED ADDITIVE «CEOFISH»

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In this article, the results of research based on veterinary-toxicological analysis of feed additive «Ceofish» are revealed. In the course of study it was found out that after dafnius and cyclopses had eaten suspensions that contained feed additive «Ceofish» they didn’t die and continued to reproduce.The study of toxicity of fish filet was carried out after trying out this feed additive on guppy-fish. Thrice-repeated experiment with two groups of test fish showed that the sample was not toxic as all guppy-fish remained alive.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: BIOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS OF LEAVES OF TILIA CORDATA IN CONDITIONS OF TECHNOGENIC POLLUTION (ON THE EXAMPLE OF THE CITY NABEREZHNYE CHELNY)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article describes physiological and biochemical species characteristic of Tilia cordata, which grows in conditions of different contamination levels. Not only contamination level has a significant impact on the content of studied photosynthetic pigments and metabolites, but also the orientation in space of the assimilatory organs of plants.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: BRYOZOA OF THE PROVIDENCE BAY OF THE BERING SEA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Bryozoan fauna of the Providence Bay was unstudied. Thirty two species and subspecies are recorded in the Bay for the first time. Biogeograpical composition and vertical distribution are given for all bryozoan species. The bryozoan fauna of the Providence Bay has coldwater appearance.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: COMPLEXES OF MYRMECOCHOROUS PLANTS FORMICA RUFA AND F. POLYCTENA IN VARIOUS TYPES OF WOODS OF UKRAINIAN CARPATHIANS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Complexes of myrmecophytes and ants on the 3 research areas located in different types of forests in the Ukrainian Carpathians are analyzed. 24 species of myrmecophytes and were found for F. rufa and 26 for F. polyctena in coniferous forest; in deciduous - 13 and 16 respectively; in the mixed - 2 and 16 species of myrmecophytes.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF THE SUGAR-BEET ROOTS TECHNOLOGICAL QUALITIES ASSESSMENT SYSTEM

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Various formulas are used for the assessment of the beet quality. Development of the sugar-beet roots qualities assessment system is studied in the article.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: EXPERIENCE OF USE OF INTRODUCED SPECIES IN FARMSTEAD PARKS OF NOVGOROD REGION AND PERSPECTIVE OF THEIR IMPLEMENTATION IN WOOD CULTURE PRACTICE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The results of practical use of introduced species in the Novgorod region are described.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: FEATURES OF NUTRITION OF RED FOREST ANTS IN ECOSYSTEMS OF UKRAINIAN CARPATHIANS

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article deals with feeding peculiarities of two species of ants: Formica rufa and F. polyctena in the Ukrainian Carpathians for subsequent use for protection of forests from pests.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: FLORISTIC ANALYSIS OF THE “ZMEYOVA DUPKA” NATURAL LANDMARK, STARA ZAGORA REGION, SOUTH BULGARIA

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The article casts light upon the contemporary condition of the flora of the “Zmeyova dupka” Natural landmark, Stara Zagora Region, South Bulgaria. Significant floristic diversity is registered on an area of 40 hectares - 129 species of higher plants (mosses excluded), belonging to 101 genera and 40 families. Investigation is conducted in the 2006 ÷ 2008 time span and up to date in 2012.Taxonomic structure, ecological and biological type, and the floristic belonging of the components of theflora are analyzed. 4 Balkan endemics and 2 species with Nature preservation status according to the Bulgarian and international legislation are found. According to the existing legislation the territory protects object of the inanimate nature (rocky cave), but the established endemic, tertiary relicts, rare, and medicinal plants require introduction of plant preservation measures.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: INFLUENCE OF THE BENTONITE CLAY ON PROCESSES OF MINERALIZATION OF BONE TISSUE AND CARTILAGE MATRIX OF PIGLETS IN CONDITIONS OF VITAMIN-MINERAL METABOLISM PATHOLOGY

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors emphasize the fact that during violation of vitamin-mineral metabolism piglets show deep destructions of bone and cartilage tissue. Therefore researches directed to the development of a complex pharmacorrection with the use of bentonite clay become especially significant.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: INFLUENCE OF THE NURTURE DIFFERENCE ON THE PHYSIOLOGICAL CONDITION OF AMERICAN WHITE BUTTERFLY HYPHANTRIA CUNEA DRURY (LEPIDOPTERA, ARCTIIDAE)

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The influence of distinction of forage on a physiological condition of specimens of the Apsheron population of the American white butterfly is studied for the first time. It was proved that the beginning and duration of the pupate process doesn’t depend on the systematic position of a fodder plant on which the American white butterfly caterpillars develop. The physiological condition, i.e. metabolism level depends on the forage composition. In the physiological context, the 2nd generation pupae are much stronger than the 1st and if conditions allow to be formed, even the 3rd generation.It is established that depression level in the American white butterfly population dynamics is defined by the physiological condition of wintering pupae, in particular the quantity of reserve substances in a adipose body.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: MORPHOLOGICAL FEATURES OF PEYER’S PATCHES OF THE SMALL INTESTINE OF RATS AFTER INJECTION OF CYCLOPHOSPHAMIDE

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Structure of small intestine peyer’s patches of rats after cyclophosphamide injection was studied. It was revealed that on 7th and 30th day the drug shows clear immunosuppressive effect, expressed in the decreasing linear parameters of patches, emergence of the bifid dome, sections of hyperemia, aggregates of macrophages in comparison with parameters of animals observed.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: PROBLEMS OF MODERNIZATION OF THE STRUCTURE OF AGRICULTURE IN TERMS OF RUSSIA’S ACCESSION TO WTO

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: This article analyzes problems of agricultural modernization strategy, institutional modernization of the agrarian sector in the region and financial strategy.

ags:resource.dc:title: SELECTION OF THE METHOD OF FELLING AND REPRODUCTION OF WOODS – THE BASIS FOR STEADY WOOD-MANAGEMENT IN NOVGOROD REGION

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The characteristic of forests of Novgorod region is presented; methods of felling and forest reproduction are analyzed.

ags:citation.ags:citationTitle: GISAP: Biology, Veterinary Medicine and Agricultural Sciences

ags:resource.dc:title: TRENDS OF CENTAUREA JACEA L. SEED PRODUCTIVITY

dc:publisher.ags:publisherName: International Academy of Science and Higher Education (IASHE, London, UK)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The authors describe trends of Centaurea jacea L. (Asteraceae) seed productivity. Reasons for the seed productivity indicators change are analyzed. Main factors affecting the coefficient of seed productivity are identified.
